review: Great little device, but let down by greed and half-finished software.When I first got the FireTV I was ready to give it 5 stars... then the reality sank in... this isn't about Amazons "Customer Obsession", it's about selling me stuff. First it was just an emphasis on Amazon video and music over the other providers (Voice Search doesn't work with Netflix or HBO, iHeartRadio or Pandora) but then they decided to take away a row of my content and replace it with an advert for their crappy shows (and now they've started pushing adverts for apps into the space as well... I guess developers were complaining they weren't getting enough installs)Then we come to the apps themselves...* Netflix: pretty good, but no integration in voice search limits user friendliness. Quality is great.* HBO Go: turns out I can't authenticate with Comcast (but I can on other devices in our house, including the Fire tablet)* Hulu: if you read the reviews for that you'll see it has a problem playing content after it's shown you an advert... wonder if they will ever fix that* lots of missing apps - no VLC for instance, and a bunch of other things I can get with Chromecast, AndroidTV, Roku or AppleTV (or on the XboxOne/360)If it wasn't for Plex I'd probably have put this on eBay or stuck it in a drawer by now :(
